central_thesis: This issue of The Scroll of Set outlines the Temple of Set's core philosophy and practical mechanics, emphasizing individual self-evolution (Xeper) as a serious, results-oriented magical practice distinct from other traditions. It focuses on the development of inherent psychic faculties (MetaMind), structured initiation pathways, and public outreach (Dark Star), while also reinforcing internal values of individual truth, responsibility, and leadership.

structure_content.chapter_title: [1] "Always Remember that This is Real." by Constance M. Moffatt III°
structure_content.summary: Presents a biography of Magister L. Dale Seago (MerenseXmet), Treasurer of the Temple of Set, detailing his background, military service, academic achievements, and the discovery of his neter, Sekhmet. It chronicles his magical progression through the Church of Satan to becoming a corporate founder and Magister Templi in the Temple of Set. Seago's vision for the Temple involves growing large enough to facilitate subsidiary Orders dedicated to specific neters, leading to specialized knowledge and a 'reunification of various kinds of knowledge at a higher level' (Xeper into Xem). The article also highlights his marriage to Priestess Amber Seago and criticizes those who treat Setian magic as a mere game, underscoring its profound reality and seriousness.
A brief administrative note announcing the departure of R. Clayton Dozier from the Temple of Set.

structure_content.chapter_title: [3] MetaMind Movements by Robertt W. Neilly III°
structure_content.summary: Introduces the MetaMind Element, a Temple initiative focused on developing psychic abilities and ESP among Setians, with Tarot identified as a verifiable method. The author plans to create a 'dictionary' of occult and parapsychological terms with Setian-specific meanings and requests members to share personal ESP experiences to identify influencing factors. Recommendations are made for specific books on the mind from Dr. Aquino's reading list.

structure_content.chapter_title: [4] Temple of Set Lecture Service: A Dark Star is Born by Lilith Sinclair IV°
structure_content.summary: Announces the launch of 'Dark Star,' a lecture service aimed at increasing the public visibility of the Temple of Set. It describes how Priests and Priestesses, assisted by I°/II° members, will deliver lectures on various occult subjects (Satanism, witchcraft, Tarot, vampirism, ceremonial magic) to interested groups for a donation, with moral support from Masters of the Temple.

structure_content.chapter_title: [5] [Extract from a Letter] to an Aspiring Magician by Roger Whitaker III°
structure_content.summary: Provides guidance for aspiring Setian magicians, emphasizing personal responsibility for magical success and self-liberation from inertia. It asserts that Setian magic is objectively applicable and distinct from 'mystical platitudes,' rejecting concepts like 'karma' as 'guilt 'philosophized' and made sacred,' which can hinder magical efficacy. The text stresses the importance of diligent study (e.g., The Satanic Bible's 'The Theory and Practice of Satanic Magic') and precise ritual work for true Adept initiation, noting the uniqueness of Setian ways.

structure_content.chapter_title: [6] A Two-Edged Sword - Part 2 by L. Dale Seago IV°
structure_content.summary: Magister L. Dale Seago formally recognizes Amber Seago as Priestess of Set III°. He explains his initial hesitation due to potential perceptions of favoritism but asserts that their relationship necessitated an even more rigorous application of his critical faculties. This ensured Amber's recognition was earned through her own substantial efforts, fostering her inner strength and independent initiatory destiny, which he describes as creating a 'triangle' with the Prince of Darkness.
An official announcement from Magus Ronald K. Barrett, High Priest, confirming Amber Seago's recognition as Priestess of Set III°, noting her entry date into the Temple and recent relocation.
A concise, provocative statement asserting self-deification: 'You dare not make yourself God! I said: 'It's too late - I am!''

structure_content.chapter_title: [9] The Meadow by Julie Stout I°
structure_content.summary: A short, allegorical story recounting a young individual's encounter with Pan, who is depicted as a graceful creature with red eyes, blue complexion, golden-brown hair, silver horns, and goat-like legs. Pan reveals himself as the 'darker nature of man' and recognizes the narrator's unique destiny to transcend human limitations and become 'more than any other has dared,' encouraging them to pursue their dreams and self-discovery.

structure_content.chapter_title: [10] Tribute to Darkness by Constance L. Moffatt III°
structure_content.summary: A poetic homage to the 'Prince of Darkness,' expressing profound alignment with his path and ways. It celebrates a personal transition from the 'agony of light' to the 'pleasures and comfort of the dark,' affirming darkness as the true source of life's beauty and illumination.

structure_content.chapter_title: [11] Beetle Traxs: The Dung Ball Rolls Again by Robert H. Moffatt III°
structure_content.summary: Provides administrative updates regarding The Scroll of Set, including challenges with back-issues, the establishment of a secure publication room, and the transition to word-processor composition to reduce costs. It includes a philosophical meditation on 'the meaning of truth,' defining it as subjective, elusive, individual-created, and 'elite, Satanic' for Setians, distinct from past perceptions, scientific fact, or the four dimensions.

A philosophical declaration asserting the individual as the sole creator of their perceived reality, equating this act of creation with 'consummate health' and validating all personal creations as real and not mere fantasy.

key_concepts.definition: The central Setian process of individual self-creation, evolution, and becoming, signifying a profound act of self-initiation and development. The 'most effective vehicle' for Setians.
A higher, subsequent stage of Xeper, described as a 'reunification of various kinds of knowledge at a higher level,' implying a more advanced state of being and understanding.
An aspect of the individual's core essence or 'magical name,' often revealed through significant personal experiences (e.g., Magister Seago's 'SeXmet' from encountering Sekhmet).

A Temple of Set initiative focused on the systematic development of inherent psychic faculties, ESP phenomena, and higher mental functions within Setians. It seeks to demystify and make practical various forms of psychic power.

The official lecture service established by the Temple of Set to increase its public visibility. It provides lecturers (primarily Priests and Priestesses) to speak on occult subjects, distinguishing the Temple from other organizations while engaging the public.

Subjective, elusive, and actively created by the individual spirit rather than being an objective, universal, or fixed reality. For Setians, this 'truth' is considered 'elite, Satanic,' directly tied to one's initiation and evolving perception.

The ability to fully and successfully manifest one's desires, understood as a privilege and capability only truly attainable by a 'master of a specific art' or an initiated Adept, requiring knowledge of underlying principles.

Defined within the Temple of Set as 'one who is expert, master of an art, successful because of acquired knowledge/abilities of the principles involved.' This status is achieved through Setian initiation, which provides unique elements distinct from prior occult experiences.

A concept rejected by Setian philosophy. It is dismissed as 'guilt 'philosophized' and made sacred,' seen as a self-defeating mechanism that negates one's will and hinders magical success by implying negative repercussions for actions.

practical_system.description: The Setian system, as presented, is centered on individual self-evolution ('Xeper') through disciplined magical practice and the conscious development of one's consciousness and being. It advocates for the active creation of one's own reality and 'truth,' explicitly rejecting external dogmas, fixed definitions, and concepts like 'karma' or 'boomerang effect' as self-defeating. Setian magic is depicted as an 'objective' force requiring a deep understanding of 'principles involved' and the conscious application of 'objectively-motivated principles' to achieve 'Indulgence' in one's desires. The system emphasizes cultivating inner strength, independent thinking, rigorous self-examination, and the systematic exploration and development of inherent psychic faculties (MetaMind). It is presented as a practical, results-oriented magical path distinct from 'mystical platitudes' and other religious or occult traditions.
tools: Required reading, including 'The Satanic Bible' (especially 'The Theory and Practice of Satanic Magic') and 'The Dark Side' for foundational knowledge and principles.
Tarot, used for divination and as a means of developing and demonstrating ESP within the MetaMind Element.
Personal ESP experiences, collected and analyzed within the MetaMind Element to understand influencing factors.
A forthcoming 'dictionary' of occult and parapsychological terms, redefined with Setian-specific meanings to facilitate shared understanding and discourse.
Self-reflection, critical faculties, and independent thought as fundamental tools for self-initiation and magical success.
rituals: Application of 'acquired knowledge/abilities of the principles involved' to achieve desired outcomes.
Conscious application of 'objectively-motivated principles' in magical workings.
Careful examination of ritual goals, ensuring 'balance, direction, timing, desire, and imagery.'
Rejection of the 'boomerang effect' in ritual, emphasizing that actions to save oneself from repercussions may cause magical failure.
Invocation, as demonstrated by Magister Seago's experience of 'Set' coming through instead of 'Satan' in his workings.

relevant_quotes.text: It is the soul which makes the vampire what he is. And thus it is that humans can be seen in mirrors while I cannot be. It has been thought that the vampire is a myth, but it is the humans who fear me who are unreal. I see the falseness in them and in the shadow-plays they call their lives, and I will not accept this for myself.

As I was doing this, the name 'Set' kept coming in there instead of 'Satan'. I still have the original document, and it is a mixture. Occasionally it says 'Satan' and occasionally it says ‘Set'. Of course I had no way of knowing until several days later what the reason for that might be.
Magister Seago finds the Temple of Set the "most effective vehicle for Xeper".

I would like to see it grow large enough to facilitate the creation of a number of subsidiary Orders. Each Order would be dedicated to a specific neter, developing relevant and specialized forms of knowledge. Setians could go to one or another of these for initiation or development of a particular kind, then be cross-initiated into others. It is a kind of process of division or specialization for the purpose of reunification of various kinds of knowledge at a higher level. I suspect that this may end up being an important part of the process of Xeper into Xem. We already seem to be moving in this direction, and that delights me immensely.

One of my supreme peeves is new l° Setians or non-Setians who think they know something about magic. The reason I say this is that I have seen innumerable people trying to impress us - doing their little dance, as LaVey used to put it - who have nothing to impress us with and assume that because they themselves have approached the magical arts throughout their experience as being essentially a game, we must think about it the same way and not really be serious about it.
"Always remember that this is real.” We are not here to play games. We are serious about what we are doing, but that doesn't mean that we can t have fun in the process.
You dare not make yourself God! I said: 'It's too late - I am!'
Satanic magic is an applicable force in a very objective manner. Satanic magic is not, and I quote the Satanic Bible, “mystical platitudes devoid of objective reason".

You must forget any ideas of a "boomerang effect". This speaks strongly of "karma", which is nothing more than guilt "philosophized" and made sacred. Taking actions to save yourself from any boomerang effect may very well be the reason for magical failure.
The Temple of Set's ways are like those of no other religion.

There is no truth In the past, for no two beings perceive what has come to pass in the same way. If you try to define truth as what is in the present, then truth includes the ability to continuously indulge in freedom-giving doubt. Thus truth is slippery and elusive - cannot be grasped but for an instant not defined by dimensions, before it is changed, gone. Thus goes the chase through existence. There is no truth in scientific fact, because a "point in time” does not exist. Therefore truth cannot be defined as "what is". Truth does not exist in the four dimensions with which we are familiar. Truth must be an ever-elusive ideal - becomes the element of all that is desirable, becomes a very subjective thIng. It is that which the individual spirit wants to create. The truth which the Setian creates is more elite, Satanic.

I am the creator of all that I sense; it is not fantasy. It is truth. Though my creation is not defined like to yours, this is the consummate health - not ill. Nor does this make our myriad creations less real.

critical_analysis.relevance: This issue is highly relevant for understanding the foundational principles and ongoing development of the Temple of Set in 1981. It provides direct insights into the organization's self-perception, its distinction from the Church of Satan, and the evolving definitions of core magical concepts (Xeper, Xem, Setian truth). The practical initiatives (MetaMind, Dark Star) showcase its operational side, while the personal narratives, particularly that of Magister L. Dale Seago, offer a glimpse into internal culture, leadership, and the individual's path within Setianism. The emphasis on individual self-deification and the seriousness of magical practice underscores the unique trajectory of the Temple in the broader occult landscape.
critical_analysis.target_audience: The primary target audience is active members and initiates of the Temple of Set, from new I° Setians to Masters and Priests/Priestesses. It functions as an internal communication channel for administrative updates, philosophical guidance, and practical magical instruction, reinforcing the Setian worldview and addressing internal dynamics. It also implicitly targets individuals considering joining or transitioning from other occult organizations, particularly the Church of Satan, by clearly articulating the distinct and rigorous Setian path.
